Resources

htv.resources.load(data)[source]

Parses JSON data returned by toolkit.js

Parameters:

data (str | Path | list | dict) – Serialized data. It may be a JSON string/file, a serialized HtbResource (dict) or a list of them (llist[dict])

Return type:

HtbResource | list[HtbResource] | None

Returns:

the deserialized HtbResource or list of them

class htv.resources.HtbVault(path=None)[source]

Bases: object

Dataclass representing the HtbVault. It allows to manage the vault, adding/removing/opening resources, listing them or initializing/deleting the entire vault

Variables:

_path – [Path] Path to the vault. May contain environment variables

Parameters:

[str|Path] (path) – Path to the vault. If None, the default directory from conf will be used

static remove_resources(*args)[source]

Remove resources from the vault

Parameters:

args – resource(s) name or index

Return type:

int

Returns:

The number of resources deleted

makedirs(reset=False)[source]

Create vault dir structure

Parameters:

reset (bool) – If True, and the vault already exists, the vault is deleted and reset to initial state

Return type:

int

Returns:

0 if vault initialized successfully. 1 otherwise

removedirs()[source]

Removes the entire vault

Return type:

int

Returns:

0 on success

clean()[source]

Clean-up vault

Deletes hidden directories created by text editors, in addition to cached and temp files. These files/dirs usually start by ‘.’ or ‘_’. .gitignore file and .git dir are always excluded.

Return type:

int

Returns:

0 on success. 1 if an error occurred

add_resources(res, stdout=None)[source]

Add resource(s) to the vault

Parameters:

  • res (HtbResource | list[HtbResource]) – HtbResource or a list of them. If None, user will be prompt to input required Resource data

  • stdout (tqdm) – Stdout to log information. Default to STDOUT

Return type:

int

Returns:

0 on success. 1 on error

list_resources(*args, name_regex=None)[source]

List resources from the vault

Parameters:

  • args – resource types HtbResource.type

  • name_regex (str) – regex applied on the resource name. If None, no filter is applied

Return type:

list[Path] | None

Returns:

A list with the resources found, or None if no match

use_resource(*args)[source]

Opens resource(s)

Parameters:

args – Name(s) and/or index(es) of the resources to be opened

Return type:

HtbResource | VpnClient | list[HtbResource] | None

Returns:

A HtbResource, or a list of them. None if the resource could not be opened

class htv.resources.VpnClient(path=None)[source]

Bases: object

Dataclass representing a configuration for OpenVpn.

Variables:

  • __resource_dir__ – [Path] Location for these resources within the vault (relative path)

  • protocol – [str] Protocol configured in the vpn file (tcp or udp)

  • port – [int] Port configured in vpn file. Normally 443 for tcp and 1337 for udp

  • remote – [str] Full string of the remote server configured in the vpn file.

static list_resources(regex=None)[source]

List VPN resources

Parameters:

regex (str) – Regex to be applied on the resource name to filter the results. If None, no filtering

Return type:

list

Returns:

A list with the resources found in local vault

property type_name

Resource type full-name

property country: str

Country configured for this VpnClient (EU, UE, SG, AU)

property cat: str

Category configured for this VpnClient (Free, VIP, VIP+)

property server_id: int

Server id provided by HTB

property path: Path

Path to VPN configuration file

property name: str

Human-readable string representing the VpnClient (VpnClient.__str__())

open()[source]

Updates the app runtime configuration with this VPN details

Return type:

None

start(force=False)[source]

Starts the vpn using loaded configuration

Starts an openvpn process in the background. If a vpn is already running and force is False, this VPN will not be started

Parameters:

force (bool) – If True and a VPN is already running, it is stopped

Return type:

int

Returns:

0 on success. 1 if a VPN is already running

stop()[source]

Stops this VpnClient, if it is running

Return type:

int

Returns:

0 on success

status(quiet=False)[source]

Check if this VPN is running

Parameters:

quiet (bool) – If True, the VPN log is shown in the terminal

Return type:

int

Returns:

0 if VPN is stopped. 1 if running

class htv.resources.HtbModule[source]

Bases: HtbResource

Class representing an HTB Module

Variables:

  • TIER_COST – [dict] Mapping tier-cost

  • COST_TIER – [dict] Mapping cost-tier

  • _type – [str] mod

  • cost – [int] Module cost (in cubes)

  • duration – [str] Approximated time required to complete the module (days-hours)

  • summary – [str] Brief summary of the module

  • sections – [str] Module sections (Section)

property tier: str

Module tier (0, I, II, III, IV)

property total_sections: int

Return the total number of sections included in this module

to_dict()[source]
Return type:

dict

Returns:

Dict representation of this Module

update(**kwargs)[source]

Update the module attributes

Parameters:

kwargs – Module attributes to be updated

Return type:

None

Returns:

None

makedirs()[source]

Create dir structure for this Module in the configured vault

Return type:

None

Returns:

None

add_section(_type, name)[source]

Adds a new section to this module

Parameters:

  • _type (str) – Type of section (interactive / document)

  • name (str) – Title of the section. May contain spaces

Return type:

Section

Returns:

the new Section added

remove_section(index)[source]

Removes a section from this module

Parameters:

index (int) – Index of the section to be removed

Return type:

Section

Returns:

the removed Section

class htv.resources.HtbPath(res_type=None)[source]

Bases: HtbResource

Abstract class representing a Path in the HTB academy

Variables:

  • _progress – [float] Completion progress

  • cost – [int]: Path total cost (in cubes)

  • duration – [str] Approximated time to complete the path (days)

  • sections – [int] Total number of sections included in the path

  • modules – [list[HtbModule]] List of modules included in the path

property tier: str

Aggregated tier, combining all tiers of this path’s modules

property status: str

Completion status string

to_dict()[source]
Return type:

dict

Returns:

dict representation of this path

update(**kwargs)[source]

Update this path attributes

Parameters:

kwargs – Path attributes to be updated

Return type:

None

Returns:

None

makedirs(missing_ok=False)[source]

Create the directory structure of the path, including the corresponding modules

Parameters:

missing_ok (bool) – If True, user will not be prompted to add the missing modules

Return type:

None

Returns:

None

class htv.resources.HtbLabResource(res_type=None)[source]

Bases: HtbResource

Abstract class representing a resource from HTB lab

Variables:

tasks – [list[Task]] List of tasks associated to this resource

to_dict(*args, path=None)[source]
Parameters:

path (str | Path) – If provided, write dumps the returned dict into this path

Return type:

dict

Returns:

dict representation of this resource

update(**kwargs)[source]

Update machine attributes

Parameters:

kwargs – Machine Attributes to be updated

Return type:

None

Returns:

None

makedirs()[source]

Create dir structure for this resource within the configured vault

If the resource already exists in the local vault, only its info.json file will be updated

Return type:

None

Returns:

None

add_task(text=None, answer=None, points=0, index=None)[source]

Adds a new Task to this machine

Parameters:

  • text (str) – Text of the task

  • answer (str) – Answer of the task

  • points (int) – Points of the task

  • index (int) – Index of the task. Defaults to None (auto-increment)

Return type:

Task

Returns:

the added Task

remove_task(index)[source]

Removes a Task from this machine

Parameters:

index (int) – Index of the Task to be removed

Return type:

Task

Returns:

the removed Task
